[SPELLING]: "stuff" used instead of "that" or "the" in "the stuff barn" and "a stuff where the peak".
[SYNTAX]: Awkward preposition in "as over the misdemeanour".

[CLARITY]: Typos with "stuff" create confusion in descriptions.
[LOGIC]: Sudden shift to backstory of Anthony Croft without clear transition.

[SYNTAX]: Long, complex sentences with semicolons and em dashes that may disrupt flow.
[LEXICON]: Some archaic or overly elaborate phrasing ("incarnate Why and How," "vital relation with life and law").
[PUNCTUATION]: Overuse of em dashes and quotation marks in dialogue sections.
[STRUCTURE]: Sudden shifts between narrative and abstract philosophical questions.

[LOGIC]: Abrupt transition from schoolyard antics to philosophical musings without clear connection.
[TRANSITION]: Sudden shift from Tony's punishment under the desk to his later self-education in the woods.
[CLARITY]: Disconnected imagery in the plant/flower descriptions that seems unrelated to preceding narrative.
[STRUCTURE]: Jarring contrast between concrete actions (snapping tuning fork) and abstract questions about existence.
